In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a function `wrap_string` in Julia that wraps text according to the given `text_width`:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_lines = String[]
    line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(wrapped_lines, line)
            line = ""
        end

        if !isempty(line)
            line *= " "
        end

        line *= word
    end

    push!(wrapped_lines, line)
    return joined(wrapped_lines, "\n")
end
```

Here's an example of how to use the function with a default maximum text width of 10:

```julia
long_text = "This is an example of a long text that will be wrapped by the wrap_string function."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(long_text)

println(wrapped_text)
```

